intro: Aeschynomene evenia, commonly known as partridge pea, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to dry conditions. It has a deep root system that helps in nitrogen fixation, making it valuable for soil enrichment. Aeschynomene evenia is also used in forage and as a cover crop in agricultural settings.
